Description: Rim sherd of East Greek black-figured pottery column-krater. Broken maeander frieze on top of rim, black, and one red, rectangles on outside; on shoulder, ill-drawn and incised head to right and perhaps upper part of a wing (sphinx with head reversed?). Inside: brown-black band with added white and red lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 4-5, N 13)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 42, no. C. 2)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (II D et III C, p. 5, pl. II. no. 9.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.310)
